intro: Fagara tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with white or pale yellow petals. Fagara tenuifolia is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
